itemDescription: Scottish World War I flying ace

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant Charles Crichton Robson  (born 1895, date of death unknown) was a Scottish World War I observer ace credited with eight aerial victories.

response: * Charles Robson (cricketer) (1859–1943), English cricketer and manager of Southampton F.C.
* Charles Robson (RAF officer) (1895–?), British World War I flying ace
